name: Citadelle Laferrière
description: A massive 19th-century fortress built on a mountain, symbolizing Haiti's independence.

name: Bassin Bleu
description: A series of stunning turquoise waterfalls and natural pools hidden in the mountains near Jacmel.

name: Saut-d’Eau Waterfall
description: A sacred waterfall and pilgrimage site known for its spiritual significance and natural beauty.

name: Labadee
description: A private beach resort area known for its beautiful coastline and cruise ship port.

name: Sans-Souci Palace
description: The ruins of a once grand royal palace of King Henri Christophe, near the Citadelle.

name: Île-à-Vache
address: Off the coast of Les Cayes, Sud Department, Haiti
description: A serene island with white sand beaches, coral reefs, and peaceful resorts.

name: Jacmel Historic District
description: A colorful coastal town known for its colonial architecture, art, and vibrant Carnival.

name: Gelee Beach
description: One of the longest and most popular beaches in Haiti, perfect for relaxing and enjoying seafood.
